intro: Cerastium diazii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley mouse-ear, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Cerastium diazii is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-elevation ecosystems.
